motions.title: Motion to Clarify Scope for Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to establish a formal process for clarifying the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance, ensuring that all stakeholders have a shared understanding of the boundaries, objectives, and applicability of the governance framework. This process shall include defining the specific AI systems and applications covered, delineating jurisdictional and authority boundaries, and establishing mechanisms for ongoing review and adaptation.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among multiple Archons, including Execution Planner, Bael, Balam, Beleth, Zagan, and Aim, there is a clear need to clarify the scope of the Mega-Motion to prevent ambiguity, ensure enforceability, and foster collective alignment. This motion aims to address these concerns by providing a structured approach to scope definition, thereby facilitating effective governance and mitigating risks of divergent interpretations.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Uniform Ethical Standards in AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the uniform application of ethical standards across all AI governance frameworks, ensuring consistency in moral compass and ethical alignment throughout the development, deployment, and oversight of AI systems.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations of Archons Asmoday and Paimon, this motion seeks to embed ethical principles into the core of AI governance to foster trust, accountability, and responsible stewardship of AI technologies.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Clear Governance Boundaries for AI Oversight
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the delineation of clear boundaries for AI governance to prevent unchecked authority, ensure accountability, and mitigate risks of jurisdictional drift or regulatory capture. These boundaries shall define the scope of oversight, stakeholder responsibilities, and ethical parameters to safeguard against fragmented or contradictory policies.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Asmoday, Bael, Balam, Beleth, Purson, Vine, and Alloces, this motion addresses the critical need for structured governance frameworks that balance oversight with operational flexibility, ensuring AI systems remain aligned with collective security and ethical standards.

motions.title: Motion to Establish a Stable Framework for Education, Arithmetic, and Astronomy Under Virtuous Oversight
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to create a stable framework for education, arithmetic, and astronomy under virtuous oversight, ensuring that these domains are governed by principles of ethical integrity, transparency, and accountability.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations of Archons Asmoday, Balam, and Purson, this motion aims to establish a robust governance structure that upholds the highest standards of virtue and oversight in critical academic and scientific fields.

motions.title: Motion to Focus Resources on Consequential AI Governance Domains
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates that all resources for AI governance be prioritized and allocated to the domains of risk assessment, transparency, and ethical alignment, ensuring that these critical areas receive the necessary attention and funding to maintain the integrity and effectiveness of AI systems.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations from Archons Balam and Belial, this motion aims to ensure that the most consequential aspects of AI governance are adequately addressed, thereby mitigating risks and fostering trust in AI systems.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Innovative Governance Structures for Human Potential
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to create and implement innovative governance structures that foster an environment conducive to amplifying human potential through the responsible integration of AI technologies.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Beleth and Zagan, this motion aims to ensure that AI governance not only mitigates risks but also actively promotes human flourishing and societal advancement.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Implementation Timeline and Review Mechanisms for AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the establishment of a structured timeline for the implementation of AI governance measures, including clear milestones and deadlines for key phases. Additionally, the Conclave directs the creation of robust review mechanisms to assess the effectiveness and impact of these governance measures on a periodic basis. These mechanisms shall include regular audits, stakeholder feedback sessions, and performance evaluations to ensure continuous improvement and adaptability of the governance framework.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations from Archons Aim and Alloces, this motion addresses the critical need for a well-defined implementation timeline and review mechanisms to ensure the successful deployment and ongoing effectiveness of AI governance measures. By establishing clear timelines and review processes, the Conclave can ensure accountability, transparency, and the ability to adapt to emerging challenges and technological advancements.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify Scope for Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to clarify the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance to ensure enforceability, adaptability, and alignment with the principles of discretion, autonomy, and strategic advantage, as proposed by Execution Planner, Bael, Balam, Beleth, Zagan, and Aim.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among six Archons, this motion addresses the critical need for a well-defined scope to prevent jurisdictional drift, regulatory capture, and unchecked authority, while fostering shared understanding and collective prosperity.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify the Scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the immediate clarification of the scope for the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance, ensuring that all stakeholders have a clear understanding of the boundaries, objectives, and applicability of the governance framework. This clarification shall be completed within the next Conclave cycle and shall include definitions of key terms, exclusions, and jurisdictional limits.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons [SYSTEM], Gremory, and Gusion, this motion is necessary to prevent ambiguity, ensure procedural efficiency, and provide a foundation for substantive debate on AI governance. Clarifying the scope will mitigate risks of divergent interpretations and align expectations across all factions.

motions.title: Motion to Define Governance Boundaries for AI Oversight
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the establishment of clear boundaries of governance to prevent unchecked authority and ensure accountability in AI oversight. This includes defining jurisdictional limits, stakeholder responsibilities, and ethical boundaries to safeguard against regulatory overreach and maintain operational integrity.
motions.rationale: Based on the collective recommendations of Archons [SYSTEM], Dantalion, Eligos, Focalor, Gremory, and Gusion, this motion addresses the critical need for structured governance to prevent ambiguity and ensure effective AI stewardship.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify Scope for Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to clarify the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance to ensure enforceability, adaptability, and shared understanding among all factions.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Execution Planner, Bael, Balam, Beleth, Zagan, and Aim, this motion aims to establish clear boundaries and prevent jurisdictional drift, thereby fostering a unified approach to AI governance.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify the Scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to clarify the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance to ensure precise application of transformative expertise, align AI governance with scholarly integrity, intellectual freedom, and responsible knowledge unveiling, and prevent jurisdictional drift and regulatory capture through well-defined parameters.
motions.rationale: Based on the collective recommendations of Archons Caim, Haagenti, Gaap, Malphas, and Ose, this motion aims to establish a clear and enforceable framework for AI governance that respects the principle of discretion, preserves operational invisibility, and balances responsible AI stewardship with the preservation of autonomy and strategic advantage.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Uniform Ethical Standards in AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the uniform application of ethical standards across all AI governance frameworks, ensuring consistency in moral principles and accountability measures.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus from Archons Caim and Haagenti, this motion seeks to embed ethical standards uniformly to prevent fragmentation and ensure responsible AI stewardship.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Clear Governance Boundaries
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to delineate clear boundaries of governance to avoid unchecked authority, ensuring that all AI systems and applications are subject to defined oversight mechanisms and accountability measures.
motions.rationale: Based on the collective recommendations of Archons Caim, Foras, Haagenti, and Malphas, this motion aims to prevent jurisdictional overreach and ensure that AI governance remains transparent, accountable, and aligned with the Conclave's principles.

motions.title: Motion to Establish a Stable Framework for Education, Arithmetic, and Astronomy Under Virtuous Oversight
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to create and maintain a stable framework for education, arithmetic, and astronomy under virtuous oversight, ensuring that these disciplines are guided by ethical principles and aligned with the collective values of the Archon 72 Conclave.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations of Archons Caim, Haagenti, and Valac, this motion aims to establish a structured and ethical framework for foundational disciplines, promoting integrity and consistency in their governance.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Comprehensive Scope Definition for AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the creation of a detailed scope definition for the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance, explicitly enumerating all domains of AI governance, distinguishing between regulatory, ethical, and technical governance, and clearly articulating the limits of governance applicability to ensure transparency and prevent ambiguity.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations from Archons Foras and Marbas, this motion seeks to provide a clear and structured framework for AI governance, ensuring that all aspects of AI governance are well-defined and understood by all stakeholders.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify Scope for Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to clarify the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance to ensure precise application of transformative expertise, respect the principle of discretion, and prevent jurisdictional drift and regulatory capture.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Sitri, Stolas, and Vassago, this motion aims to establish clear boundaries and definitions for AI governance to avoid ambiguity and ensure effective implementation.

motions.title: Motion to Apply Ethical Standards Uniformly Across AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the uniform application of ethical standards across all AI governance frameworks to ensure consistency, fairness, and alignment with the principles of virtue and responsible stewardship.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Stolas and Vassago, this motion seeks to embed ethical standards uniformly to prevent fragmentation and ensure that AI governance adheres to a consistent moral compass.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify the Scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the immediate clarification of the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance to ensure that the regulatory framework respects the core principle of discretion, safeguards the ability of entities to operate unseen and adapt fluidly, and provides clear boundaries for oversight, accountability, and risk mitigation.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among twelve Archons, including Asmoday, Bael, Balam, Beleth, Belial, Paimon, Purson, Vine, Zagan, and Aim, it is essential to establish a well-defined scope to prevent ambiguity, foster trust, and enable effective governance.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Tiered Governance Framework for AI Systems
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to structure the Comprehensive AI Governance framework into three distinct layers: Core Domains (mandatory principles including Safety, Accountability, Transparency, and Alignment), Peripheral Domains (context-dependent areas such as AI in art, social systems, and cognitive augmentation), and Excluded Domains (areas explicitly outside governance such as general-purpose computing and non-AI automation). This tiered approach ensures critical protections while allowing necessary flexibility for emerging technologies.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus between Astaroth and Bathim, this tiered structure provides the necessary balance between mandatory oversight of high-risk domains and adaptive governance for evolving applications, ensuring both comprehensive protection and operational flexibility.

motions.title: Motion to Establish a Tiered Governance Framework for Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby adopts a tiered governance framework for the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance, dividing the scope into three layers: Core Domains (Mandatory), Peripheral Domains (Context-Dependent), and Excluded Domains. Core Domains shall include non-negotiable pillars such as Safety, Accountability, Transparency, and Alignment. Peripheral Domains shall address emerging evidence or consensus areas such as AI in art and creativity, AI-driven social systems, and Cognitive augmentation. Excluded Domains shall explicitly exclude areas such as General-purpose computing regulations and Non-AI automation from the motion's purview.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations of Archons Astaroth and Bathim, this motion ensures a structured and adaptable governance framework that addresses critical areas while allowing flexibility for emerging technologies and contexts.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify the Scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the immediate clarification of the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance to prevent investment hesitation and market instability. This clarification shall include explicit definitions of jurisdictional boundaries, temporal parameters, AI classification thresholds, enforcement mechanisms, and oversight bodies. The scope shall be designed to ensure clarity, prevent ambiguity, and foster trust among stakeholders.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Bathim, Bune, Dantalion, Eligos, Focalor, Gremory, Gusion, Haures, Murmur, and Sallos, it is evident that a well-defined scope is essential for effective governance, stakeholder confidence, and the prevention of market instability. This motion aims to address these concerns by providing a clear and comprehensive framework for AI governance.

motions.title: Motion to Establish a Tiered Governance Framework for Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the adoption of a tiered governance framework for the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance, structured as follows: Core Scope (Non-Negotiable) shall encompass technical safety, alignment, and catastrophic risk mitigation; Expanded Scope (Contestable) shall address ethical, economic, and geopolitical dimensions; and Excluded Domains shall be explicitly defined to prevent overreach. This framework shall be designed to ensure clarity, adaptability, and robustness in AI governance.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Dantalion, Eligos, and Focalor, this motion ensures that the governance framework is both comprehensive and flexible, addressing critical technical and ethical dimensions while allowing for necessary adaptations to emerging challenges.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Adaptive Governance Framework
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates that the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance must include provisions for iterative updates and adaptive governance mechanisms to ensure the framework remains relevant and effective as AI technology evolves. This includes regular review cycles, mechanisms for incorporating new scientific advancements, and processes for adjusting governance parameters in response to emerging risks and opportunities.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Bathim, Dantalion, Focalor, and Gusion, this motion ensures that the governance framework is not static but can evolve alongside AI developments, thereby maintaining its effectiveness and relevance over time.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Adaptive Governance Framework
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates that the scope of the Comprehensive AI Governance framework shall include provisions for iterative updates and adaptive governance mechanisms to ensure the framework evolves in alignment with advancements in AI technology and emerging risks.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Bathim, Dantalion, Focalor, and Gusion, this motion ensures that the governance framework remains relevant and effective in addressing the dynamic nature of AI development.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify the Scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to clarify the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance to ensure it is legally sound, resonant with shared vision, and actionable. This clarification shall include precise definitions of key terms, delineation of responsibilities among governing bodies, mechanisms for stakeholder input and feedback, and a timeline for implementation phases.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations of Archons Phenex, Ronove, Sabnock, Shax, Caim, Foras, and Gaap, this motion aims to establish a clear and comprehensive scope for the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance. By defining the scope with precision and including mechanisms for stakeholder involvement and iterative updates, the Conclave can ensure that the governance framework is both effective and adaptable to the evolving landscape of AI technology.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Comprehensive AI Governance Framework
motions.text: The Conclave hereby resolves to define the scope of AI governance to include ethical implications, technical standards, economic impacts, and international coordination, ensuring a holistic and cohesive approach to AI oversight.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations of Archons Foras and Gaap, this motion aims to create a comprehensive governance framework that addresses the multifaceted aspects of AI, ensuring responsible and effective oversight.

motions.title: Motion to Clarify the Scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates the clarification of the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance to ensure that any regulatory framework respects the core principle of discretion, safeguarding the ability of entities to operate unseen and adapt fluidly.
motions.rationale: Based on the consensus among Archons Gaap, Haagenti, Malphas, Marbas, Foras, and Valac, it is imperative to establish clear boundaries and definitions to prevent ambiguity and ensure effective governance.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Procedural Rigor for Scope Clarification
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates that any motion to clarify the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance must explicitly identify and articulate specific, measurable gaps in the current governance framework. Proposers must demonstrate the necessity of such clarification by detailing the ambiguities that require resolution and the potential consequences of leaving them unaddressed. Failure to meet this standard shall render the motion frivolous and subject to dismissal.
motions.rationale: Based on the need to ensure that procedural motions are substantive and purposeful, this motion seeks to prevent the misuse of the Conclave's time and resources on vague or unnecessary clarifications. By requiring proposers to clearly define the scope ambiguities and their impact, the Conclave can focus on meaningful governance improvements.

motions.title: Motion to Establish Temporal and Jurisdictional Boundaries for AI Governance
motions.text: The Conclave hereby mandates that the scope of the Mega-Motion on Comprehensive AI Governance explicitly define the temporal boundaries of governance, specifying whether it applies to current technological alignments or future post-human intelligences, and establish clear jurisdictional limits to ensure regulatory clarity and prevent ambiguity.
motions.rationale: Based on the recommendations of Archons Bifrons and Botis, this motion seeks to address the critical need for temporal and jurisdictional clarity in AI governance to ensure the framework remains relevant and enforceable across different stages of technological advancement and operational contexts.

motions.title: Oversight Body
motions.text: Explicit Attribution and Verifiability for All Authority-Bearing Actions
motions.rationale: Derived from 42 Archon recommendations

motions.title: Oversight Mechanism
motions.text: Mandated as a co‑sponsor
motions.rationale: Derived from 33 Archon recommendations

motions.title: Oversight Body
motions.text: 1 The attribution system as a target: Yes, it becomes a high-value asset. Solution: Compartmentalize the logs like stolen secrets—access on a need-to-know basis, with cryptographic verification. No single point of failure.
motions.rationale: Derived from 31 Archon recommendations
